election_record.label: New York 1824 Lieutenant Governor, Nomination, Ballot 2

overview.note: "State Convention. Utica, September 22. The Convention met today agreeably to adjournment. In order to ascertain the sentiments of the members, an informal ballot was taken for a candidate for Governor, when 121 votes were taken as follows:" Alexandria Gazette and Advertiser (Alexandria, VA). October 2, 1824.
"The Convention have after two ballots to-day come to the following result:" The Berks and Schuylkill Journal (Reading, PA). October 2, 1824.

election_record.reference: Baltimore Patriot and Mercantile Advertiser (Baltimore, MD). September 27, 1824.
Alexandria Gazette and Advertiser (Alexandria, VA). October 2, 1824.
The Berks and Schuylkill Journal (Reading, PA). October 2, 1824.
